Langsam Fragments:

Section

Langsam Resources

Those with knowledge of the The Langsam-Spira Family book will find this index familiar. It makes use of the same numbering scheme utilized in the book.

These links may be useful in either locating or expanding upon your family:

  • H1 Pesach Langsam b. 1830's, with son Mendel from Jaroslaw
  • H2 - The Reisel Adler nee Langsam Family b. 1864
  • H3 - The Etka Ringelheim nee Langsam Family b. 1850's
  • H4/H18 Israel Langsam b. 1830's
  • H5 - The Necha Adler nee Langsam Family c.1900
  • H6 - Shmuel Langsam of Dobrow b. 1840/1850's
  • H7- The Mayer Langsam Family
  • H8 Yehoshua Chaim Langsam of Hucisko, Poland
  • H9 - H10 Langsam Families
  • H9 - The Esther Jacobs nee Langsam Family
  • H11 - Judah Langsam

  • H17 - Jacob Langsam

  • H27 - The Pesach Langsam Family

  • H34 - The Efraim Langsam Family of Lutowska, Poland 1854 - 1929

  • H36 - Hersch (Zvi) Langsam of Blazow b. 1870
  • H45 is connected to H13
  • H46 - Michael (Mechel) Langsam of Grybow (1866 - 1932)
  • H58 - Morris Langsam, son of Isaac (1871 - 1919)
  • H59/H19 - Selig(?) Langsam of Krakow b. 1850/60's
  • H60 should be combined with H71
  • H63 = H20 Rose Kopita nee Langsamb. 1880's
Fragments not known to be in the Langsam-Spira Family book
  • H64 - Akiva Langsam (c.1850 - <1915)

  • H70 - Pinchus Langsam of Tyreva Woleska
  • H71 - Pesach & Moishe Langsam (part of H60)
  • H72 - Walter Langsam
  • H73 - The Charna Rivka Rosenbach Family

  • H76 - Yissochor Dov (Beirish) Langsam of Bircza/Sanok Family

  • H80 - Michael Langsam (1834 - 1938) of Inwald, Poland
  • H81 - Shmiel Langsam of Drobitzka (Debica?)
  • H82 - Iosef Langsam of Argentina
  • H83 - Alfred Langsam - FIX THIS PAGE

  • H96 - Sarah Langsam (born circa 1840) married Joseph Kandel of Stryzow
  • H97 - Leibush Langsam (born circa 1900) of Tyrawa Woloska

  • H99 - Pinkus Langsam from Bielsko-Biala and Indonesia
  • H100 - Sora Grumet nee Langsam from Sanok, born circa 1850
  • X1 - Langsam - NOT!

The links to the left contain information, sometimes in the form of an e-mail, that enhances what may already be known from The Langsam-Spira Family book.

I would be very interested to hear from anyone with knowledge or an interest in the Miller family.

Moishe Miller
moishe@langsam.com
